answerText: CRISPRs [or Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats; or CRISPR-Cas 9][10] Gene therapy using CRISPR works because it induces this type of damage to a DNA strand. Repairing this class of DNA damage requires non-homologous end joining or homologous recombination.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Penn A-Northmont-Chicago B | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this system by which prokaryotes insert short repeats of pathogenic DNA into their genomes, which can then function as adaptive immunity against the pathogen.
